intro: Ctenitis sotoana, commonly known as the Soto's tree fern, is a species of tree fern native to the wet tropical forests of South America. It belongs to the family Cyatheaceae and is characterized by its tall, slender trunk and large, feather-like fronds. The plant thrives in humid, shaded environments and requires well-drained, nutrient-rich soil. Its fronds can grow up to several meters in length, contributing to its ornamental value. Ctenitis sotoana plays an important ecological role in its native habitat by providing shelter and food for various wildlife species.
